biography.name: Maroš Beťko
biography.headline: Front-end developer and game designer
biography.summary: I'm studying Informatics and Design on Masaryk University in Brno. Game development is one of my biggest passions. In my free time I try to develop my skills in this field, ranging from coding to art development. I have an ongoing game project that I like to develop and expand, and try new ideas on. I like challenges that require creative thinking and solving them inspires and motivates me. I'm thorough and organized and hate shoddy quality work and that is what I want my work to reflect.

projects.name: The Pied Fisherman of Hamelin
projects.description: My entry for the second #BrackeysGameJam with a theme Love is blind. Game scored 2nd in inovation and overall in first third from over 300 entries.</br></br>Game descripton:</br></br>Your task is to lead all the zombies out of the city to the brain flower. They are hiding inside canals and will come out if they smell brains. Zombies are mostly interested only in fresh brains but will attack anything that blocks their way. Clear out barricades with zombies, but be careful because they aren't immortal. Also try not to wreck the city too much on your way out.</br></br>Throw and pull brain by holding mouse1 and aim with mouse. Move with WASD and rotate camera with Q and E.

projects.name: DreamQuest
projects.description: Dream-Quest is a competitive game for 2-5 players, playable in around two hours. The players assume the role of a dreamer, existing in two different realities at once – the Dream World and the Real World. The Real World represents the repetitive routine of everyday life, that the characters have to endure before going to sleep and continuing their epic quest in the alternate reality.

projects.name: Michelangelo for Unity
projects.description: Unity package that brings Michelangelo procedural modeling to Unity. Create, edit and generate models with Michelangelo grammars directly in Unity's editor.

projects.name: Metal Rain
projects.description: Space, year unknown. Intense space battle.  One of the ships received several hits and the human aboard was badly injured and forced to make an emergency landing on the close planet. Afterward, this person went to a cryosleep to increase the chances of survival. Your task, computer, is to take care of the ship, fix it using the robots and get the hell outta here!

projects.name: One life item browser
projects.description: One hour one life is a unique game that contains hundreds of items and even more options of combining them. This project aims to visualize the database of all items and their combination possibilities. Content of this page is populated directly from the public data repository (https://github.com/jasonrohrer/OneLifeData7) of the game's publisher.

projects.name: Pixel Monastery Script
projects.description: Pixel Monastery Script is a blackletter pixel font. It's aim is to faithfully transfer elegance of medieval handwritten scripts into the limited space of pixel art. It was made for use in medieval and fantasy pixel art and games and is drawn in a strict pixel grid with default height of 30 pixels. With this size, it's best suited to be used for titles, but with higher fidelity pixelart, it also fits as a paragraph font. With OpenType features enabled, all numbers are typeset in proper roman numeral format up to millions.

images.title: Font usage in pixel art game

projects.name: The Early Academic Expeditions of Randolph T. Lewis Jr.
projects.description: Airship Nightingale, on route to the Academy of Science, has been blown away by a violent thunderstorm into unknown air, where it crash-landed on an uncharted floating island. The player assumes the role of young Randolph Lewis, who was recently accepted to the University and had left home on his uncle’s (the captain) ship. The rest of the crew have to tend to the wounded and repair the ship, while Randolph is sent to look for supplies on the island. He encounters a variety of local fauna and flora, some of it friendly, some hostile. Randolph, being a young curious student of geography, is amazed by the size of the lost island and by the bizarre creatures and plants he encounters. The aim of the crew, and ultimately of Randolph as well, is to repair the ship and depart as soon as possible.

projects.description: Implementation of collision detection algorith used in 3D breakout game. Game is situated on circular play area, with bricks in the middle and 3 paddles around the side. Player can rotate the paddles in order to destroy all teh bricks in the middle. Implementation was done in OpenGL and C++ with the use of custom geometric classes.

projects.name: Time Is Running Out
projects.description: Small game project for Ludum Dare Mini 70 completed in less than a month from scratch. Theme of the competition was to create a game without any random elements to it. Point of the game was to manage up to 9 cities by deciding what state they should be in to positively affect each other. Main task for player is to find out what each state does and come up with a tactic for each level on how to obtain the most points possible. Created with Game Maker.
